    • Constructor Detail

      • AnswerChoice

        public AnswerChoice()
        Default constructor. Initializes an unlocked answer choice. Answer choice must be locked at time of creation to be opened by the test viewer.

      • AnswerChoice

        public AnswerChoice(java.lang.String visibleChoiceID,
            java.lang.String text,
            boolean isActive,
            boolean isCorrect)
        Advanced constructor. Initializes an unlocked answer choice. Answer choice must be locked at time of creation to be opened by the test viewer.
        Parameters:
        visibleChoiceID - this is the string that will identify the answer choice. ID's will remain in order even if the answer choices are scrambled. (e.g. ABC will still be ABC)
        text, - this is the text of the answer
        isActive - denotes if the answer active. Only active answers will be written to the final exam file. For example, if a multiple choice question consists of 6 out of 8 answers, then there will be two inactive answers.
        isCorrect - denotes if the answer is correct

      • AnswerChoice

        AnswerChoice(java.lang.String visibleChoiceID,
            java.lang.String text,
            boolean isActive,
            boolean isCorrect,
            boolean isLocked)
        Protected advanced constructor. Initializes an answer choice. Only the package local constructor may initialize a locked AnswerChoice. This deters unauthorized modifications to exam data.
        Parameters:
        visibleChoiceID - this is the string that will identify the answer choice. ID's will remain in order even if the answer choices are scrambled. (e.g. ABC will still be ABC)
        text, - this is the text of the answer
        isActive - denotes if the answer active. Only active answers will be written to the final exam file. For example, if a multiple choice question consists of 6 out of 8 answers, then there will be two inactive answers.
        isCorrect - denotes if the answer is correct
        isLocked - denotes if the answer is locked

      • isCorrect

        public final boolean isCorrect()
        get if an unlocked answer choice is correct. Locked answer choices will always return false. The only access to locked answers correct value is through a protected method. This deters unauthorized access to exam data.
        Returns:

      • setCorrect

        public final boolean setCorrect(boolean isCorrect)
        sets if the answer choice is correct, only if is unlocked
        Parameters:
        isCorrect - if the choice is correct

      • getUnlockedAnswer

        public final AnswerChoice getUnlockedAnswer()
        Returns an unlocked answer choice from a locked answer choice after stripping protected data.
        Returns:
        an unlocked answer
